chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald L Altgilbers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 3 days were granted. To report 03/28/16 by 5pm.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance to be refunded to poster.
Register as a Sex Offender and participate in treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent or any term deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: 09/30/2020 COURT MODIFIES SENTENCE TO 11.5 YEARS OF PROBATION WITHHELD, NUNC PRO TUNC TO 03/18/2016 ORIGINAL SENTENCE DATE. SAME CONDITIONS AS PREVIOUSLY STATED.

superTimeConds.notes: To perform 50 HOURS PER YEAR of Community Service at the discretion of the Agent.

Sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Donald L Altgilbers in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kohn advises the Court that the parties have reached a resolution and an amended information will be filed by the State.    The State files an amended information on the case.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Count #1 in the amended information.   Attorney Kohn requests the Court order a presentence investigation report.  The State does not object to the requst. The Court orders a PSI be prepared without a recommendation by the author and be filed with the Court in 45 days.  Bail remains as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jury status hearing on October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steven Kohn in court.   Defendant Donald L Altgilbers did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance waived. Defense requests a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Donald L Altgilbers in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is still discussing this matter with the State and requests another date in 60 days. Court grants request.  Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed. Additional discovery and the pretrial offer handed over to Defense counsel from the State.   Defense requests his client be excused on the next date. Court grants request and will excuse the defendant on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
